channel.title: KenSmith tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from KenSmith.

item.description: When activists speak, they the words that reflect their world view. Politicos and bureaucrats always try to take over and redefine the key terms asserted by others. I lost the source, but a few days ago I read a comment making that point.
item.source:markdown: When activists speak, they the words that reflect their world view. Politicos and bureaucrats always try to take over and redefine the key terms asserted by others. I lost the source, but a few days ago I read a comment making that point.

item.description: Mikhail Bakhtin was interested in the ways the logics and power plays of a society's various discourses can be made easier to see.
item.source:markdown: Mikhail Bakhtin was interested in the ways the logics and power plays of a society's various discourses can be made easier to see.

item.description: T F To learn an academic discipline is to seal yourself within its thick, windowless walls.
item.source:markdown: T F To learn an academic discipline is to seal yourself within its thick, windowless walls.

item.description: Clues to the various ways the powerful speak differently when they know we can hear them, act differently when we know they can see them?
item.source:markdown: Clues to the various ways the powerful speak differently when they know we can hear them, act differently when we know they can see them?

item.description: I wonder if there's a U. S. prison where inmates are allowed to wear layers of shirts.
item.source:markdown: I wonder if there's a U. S. prison where inmates are allowed to wear layers of shirts.

item.description:
“They like our silence, when they can get it.”

(old bumper sticker)
item.source:markdown:
“They like our silence, when they can get it.”
(old bumper sticker)

item.description:
@jmartinwrites This book is a wonderful and very approachable exploration of different translations of a single four-line poem, and also of your question.

https://t.co/dfhEA1iN3O

item.description:
It's hard to imagine saying this enough. "Likes don't save lives." --@GaryGulman, who wanted people to pass around the new Suicide Hotline number, 9-8-8, for both phone and text.

But it's a wider truth, too. https://t.co/mw56FdqEZ0
item.source:markdown:
It's hard to imagine saying this enough. "Likes don't save lives." --@GaryGulman, who wanted people to pass around the new Suicide Hotline number, 9-8-8, for both phone and text.
But it's a wider truth, too. https://t.co/mw56FdqEZ0

item.description: Looking at tree rings, "the authors concluded that there was probably not a drought as severe as today’s in the past 1,200 years." https://t.co/s3BaCxCFKO

item.description: Why it matters that specialists and technical people--some, at least--develop the skills to write for a wide audience of nonspecialist readers. https://t.co/LBBOodU1Ei

item.description:
Gary Gulman likes “‘Likes don’t save lives.’ —@GaryGulman’

but he might more than like folks passing around the new national Suicide Prevention Hotline number, which is 988 (call or text). https://t.co/QYk6iim6wz https://t.co/1ChovXG0TU

The new number is 988. https://t.co/GNc4ew5BRY
item.source:markdown:

item.description: Hemingway made a similar claim about writing. https://t.co/khtkDhpzQo
item.source:markdown: Hemingway made a similar claim about writing. https://t.co/khtkDhpzQo

item.description: "No major prodemocracy reforms have passed Congress. No key political figures who tried to overturn an American election have faced real accountability. The president who orchestrated the greatest threat to our democracy in modern times is free to run for reelection . . ." https://t.co/5IefGwBvKy
item.source:markdown: "No major prodemocracy reforms have passed Congress. No key political figures who tried to overturn an American election have faced real accountability. The president who orchestrated the greatest threat to our democracy in modern times is free to run for reelection . . ." https://t.co/5IefGwBvKy

item.description: "In the 21st century, most democracies die like a chronic but terminal patient. The system weakens as the disease spreads. The agony persists over years. Early intervention increases the rate of survival, but the longer the disease festers . . ." https://t.co/pJFplOG35g
item.source:markdown: "In the 21st century, most democracies die like a chronic but terminal patient. The system weakens as the disease spreads. The agony persists over years. Early intervention increases the rate of survival, but the longer the disease festers . . ." https://t.co/pJFplOG35g

item.description: I wonder if any #Orwell fans have ever run across the source of a quotation said to be from Orwell that goes, roughly, Far too much writing about rural life is done from the wrong side of a five bar gate. @Noovella
item.source:markdown: I wonder if any #Orwell fans have ever run across the source of a quotation said to be from Orwell that goes, roughly, Far too much writing about rural life is done from the wrong side of a five bar gate. @Noovella

item.description: Still silence from IN-2nd @RepWalorski / @JackieWalorski on any reasons for her vote against HR 8404, which defends people against marriage laws that discriminate based on sex, race, ethnicity, or national origin. https://t.co/Nirt2WVBjB
